season.name: Summer
disadvantages: High temperatures during planting season can severely stress or kill young saplings
tips: Plant Sunn Hemp (Taag) on the raised beds to provide natural shade and cooling.
Install physical crop covers over the saplings at the time of planting to protect them from direct, intense sunlight.

corrective.whenTooHigh: Provide shade, increase irrigation frequency, ensure proper ventilation.
corrective.whenTooLow: Use frost protection measures, mulching, or temporary covers.

tips: Monitor soil temperature, use shade cloth during peak heat, ensure adequate soil moisture.

rootInformation: Fibrous root system, mostly in the top 60 cm of soil.

tips: Monitor temperature regularly, especially during sensitive growth stages.

avoid: Extremely high humidity leading to fungal diseases.
tips: Maintain consistent humidity levels, especially during flowering and fruit development.

soil.name: Loamy, well-drained

tips: Test soil pH regularly and amend as needed.

nutrientProfile.name: Nitrogen
avoid: Deficiency leading to stunted growth, excess leading to leafy growth.

corrective.whenTooHigh: Reduce nitrogen fertilizer application; leach soil.

tips: Monitor leaf color for nitrogen deficiency; split applications for efficiency.

nutrientProfile.name: Phosphorus
avoid: Deficiency leading to poor root development; excess can interfere with micronutrient uptake.

corrective.whenTooLow: Apply phosphate fertilizer such as superphosphate.

tips: Ensure adequate phosphorus levels during early growth stages for root development.

nutrientProfile.name: Potassium
avoid: Deficiency leading to marginal leaf scorch; excess can cause magnesium deficiency.

corrective.whenTooHigh: Avoid excessive potassium fertilizer; balance with other nutrients.

tips: Potassium is crucial for fruit development; monitor levels during fruit filling.
Conduct regular soil tests to adjust nutrient levels as needed.
Incorporate organic matter to improve soil structure and fertility.

avoid: Strong winds during flowering and fruit set.
tips: Plant windbreaks perpendicular to prevailing winds.

landPreparation.function: Preparing the soil correctly for planting.
disadvantages: Incorrect preparation can lead to crop failure.

properties.name: Soil Tilth
properties.description: Loose and friable (well-aerated) soil is achieved.

properties.name: Water Drainage
properties.description: Improved water drainage to avoid waterlogging.

toolsAndResources.name: Tractor with plow
toolsAndResources.usage: Plow to a depth of at least 30 cm.

toolsAndResources.name: Subsoiler
toolsAndResources.description: Breaks up hardpans in the subsoil.
toolsAndResources.use: Improves water drainage and root penetration.
toolsAndResources.usage: Run subsoiler along rows to break up hardpans.

tips: Ensure deep plowing for proper aeration and drainage.
Consider soil testing to determine nutrient deficiencies before planting.

planting.name: Raised Bed Planting
planting.description: Planting bananas on raised beds for improved drainage and aeration.
disadvantages: Requires additional labor and resources for bed construction

supplements.name: Farmyard Manure
supplements.description: Provides essential nutrients and improves soil structure.
supplements.timeOfApplication: At the time of raised bed preparation
supplements.use: Enrich soil with organic matter and nutrients.
supplements.usage: Mix thoroughly into the soil while creating the raised beds.

supplements.name: Vermicompost
supplements.description: Enhances soil fertility and provides micronutrients.
supplements.timeOfApplication: At the time of raised bed preparation
supplements.use: Provide a rich source of micronutrients.
supplements.usage: Mix thoroughly into the soil while creating the raised beds.

supplements.name: Super Phosphate
supplements.timeOfApplication: At the time of raised bed preparation
supplements.usage: Mix thoroughly into the soil while creating the raised beds.

supplements.name: Potash
supplements.description: Provides potassium for overall plant health and fruit development.
supplements.timeOfApplication: At the time of raised bed preparation
supplements.use: Enhance fruit quality and disease resistance.
supplements.usage: Mix thoroughly into the soil while creating the raised beds.

supplements.name: Neem Cake
supplements.description: Acts as a natural insecticide and provides nitrogen.
supplements.timeOfApplication: At the time of raised bed preparation
supplements.use: Control soil pests and provide slow-release nitrogen.
supplements.usage: Mix thoroughly into the soil while creating the raised beds.

supplements.name: Gypsum
supplements.description: Improves soil structure and provides calcium and sulfur.
supplements.timeOfApplication: At the time of raised bed preparation
supplements.use: Improve soil structure and nutrient availability.
supplements.usage: Mix thoroughly into the soil while creating the raised beds.

precautions: Ensure proper drainage to avoid waterlogging.

tips: Maintain adequate spacing to ensure proper light penetration and air circulation.

season.name: Summer
reasons: Utilize the warmer temperatures for growth.
advantages: Optimal growing conditions for banana plants.
disadvantages: Risk of heat stress and water scarcity.
avoid: Planting during periods of extreme heat or drought.
tips: Provide adequate irrigation and shade during hot periods.

properties.name: Bed Width
properties.description: Provides adequate space for root development.

toolsAndResources.name: Shovel
toolsAndResources.use: Moving soil to create the beds.
toolsAndResources.usage: Use to lift and move soil to form the raised beds.

toolsAndResources.name: Measuring Tape
toolsAndResources.description: Used for ensuring correct bed dimensions.
toolsAndResources.usage: Measure the bed height (1 to 1.5 feet) and width (approximately 2.5 feet).

tips: Ensure proper bed dimensions for optimal drainage and aeration.
Mix all necessary nutrients thoroughly into the soil while creating the raised beds.

irrigation.name: Double Drip Irrigation
irrigation.description: Using two drip irrigation lines per raised bed for uniform water distribution.
advantages: Keeps the root systems on both sides of the plant active and efficient.
disadvantages: Higher initial cost compared to single drip line systems.
tips: Monitor soil moisture levels to adjust irrigation frequency as needed.
Ensure drip lines are functioning correctly to avoid water wastage.
irrigation.use: Deliver water and nutrients directly to the root zone.
irrigation.usage: Place two drip irrigation pipes on each raised bed.

toolsAndResources.name: Drip Lines
toolsAndResources.description: Pipes with emitters for delivering water directly to the plant roots.
toolsAndResources.use: Providing a consistent supply of water to the plants.
toolsAndResources.usage: Lay two drip lines along each raised bed, close to the plants.

toolsAndResources.name: Water Pump
toolsAndResources.description: Provides pressure to the irrigation system.
toolsAndResources.use: Supplying water to the drip lines.
toolsAndResources.usage: Connect the pump to a water source and adjust pressure to deliver water efficiently.

metadata.author: Prompt Optimizer
metadata.notes: Expanded version of schema with added location, season, and temperature fields for regional adaptability and environmental context.
